moves.1. e4 e5 2. Bc4 Nf6 3. Nf3: Developing, but leaving my pawn hanging.
moves.3... d5: Forks pawn and bishop.  Now my pawn is attacked by two pieces.
moves.4. Bb3 Nc6 5. Nc3: And we have a huge standoff in the center.
moves.5... d4: That is definitely going to tear my center apart.
moves.6. Nb5: Sets up the fork, but leaves the e4 pawn hanging.  Black has a stronger hold in the center.
moves.6... Nxe4 7. O-O a6: Chasing the knight away.  Obviously, however, one square for the knight looks a lot better than the others.  That's "looks," not "is" because they all suck.
moves.8. Nxc7+: A very quick move on my part, made without really thinking about it.  I was using more time than him; that could have got me into trouble quickly.
moves.9. d3: Trying to get some of the center back.
moves.9... Nc5 10. c4: Should have moved the bishop.  But I panicked due to time control, even though I had a fair amount of time left.
moves.10... Nxb3: Wins the knight for bishop exchange.
moves.11. axb3 Bd6 12. Bg5: And I grab some squares in his territory; maybe I can force him to panic.
moves.12... O-O 13. Be3: A very quick move made without thinking at all, and a huge mistake.  Should definitely have thought a little more, like how to get the a1 rook into the action.
moves.14. fxe3 e4: This was a mistake.  I could now play dxe4 and open up (most of) the d-file for my queen.
moves.15... Bxh2+ 16. Kh1: Forced, and my king is crammed in a box, but black cannot work with that without freeing the king.
moves.17. Qxd3: My queen stares bullets at the h-pawn.
moves.17... Rd8: Threatens the queen.  That rook looks like a good piece to take...
moves.20. Qxg7 Bd6: Probably could have found better moves with another second or two of searching.  He was probably counting on me getting into time trouble.
moves.21. Qxf7#: That never happens, I checkmate him with 17.5 seconds to spare.  Black ended with 36 seconds left on his clock.
